content.div:
Jennifer Aniston may not be popping out babies (or adopting a village full of orphans in Africa) but our favourite Friend is still landing magazine covers, thanks to her killer bod.

Aniston is no stranger when it comes to striking a nearly-nude pose for GQ magazine, but this time around she's taking costar Paul Rudd along for the ride -- all while rocking an itty-bitty black bra and barely-there school-girl skirt.

The Wanderlust stars sat down for a candid interview with GQ, in which Aniston pokes fun of her non-existent children and her killer body.

"Well, I recently quit smoking, and you do put on some extra pounds," she said of pregnancy rumours. "It makes a difference, especially if you're not 20. I think people maybe want me to have a kid now."

"I think that's sort of cliche, isn't it?” she added about people’s expectations for her. “Like, if you want to be happy, you should have the house, the husband, the kids... Kids are messy!"

Rudd backed her up saying, "Having two, I can verify this."

Aniston addressed the tabloid speculation surrounding her baby basket, even joking that Sarah Jessica Parker birthed one of her rumoured children, before setting the record straight by saying, "I'm drawing the line on the children conversation. You heard it here. I'm not knocked up know."

She may not be pregnant, but Aniston did gush about bringing home a new bundle of joy with boyfriend Justin Theroux: a three-month-old boxer-pit-bull mix.

Theroux also talked about the puppy in a new interview with New York magazine, saying, “She’s the most adorable little cookie you’ve ever seen. She looks like she just smoked an exploding cigar.”

Like Aniston, he stayed mum on their new relationship, telling New York magazine, “I understand the curiosity, but other than saying I am happy, I am not going to indulge it. That’s building your own torture device.”

Watch video of Aniston and Rudd’s GQ photo shoot below.
